method.name: POST
method.doc:
This web service will replace the current database configuration information with the specified values.
This will remove the current configuration and replace it with the values specified here.

request.doc:
POST https://{appliance_hostname}/isam/cluster/v2 POST_DATA: { "hvdb_db_type":"oracle", "hvdb_address":"192.168.93.110", "hvdb_port":"1521", "hvdb_user":"SYSTEM", "hvdb_password":"passw0rd", "hvdb_db_name":"ORCL", "hvdb_db_secure":true, "hvdb_db_truststore":"oracle_keys", "hvdb_driver_type":"thin", }
External databases require different sets of parameters depending on the type of database. The following examples illustrate external runtime (HVDB) databases.
External DB2 Database Definition The following keys define an external db2 runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_db_type": "db2", "hvdb_address": "db2.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "50009", "hvdb_db_secure": true, "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime",
Optionally, an additional server for HADR and ACR can be specified. "hvdb_db_alt": true, "hvdb_db2_alt_address": "db2-bak.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_db2_alt_port": "50009",
External Oracle Database Definition The following keys define an external Oracle runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_db_type": "oracle", "hvdb_address": "oracle-rac.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "49001", "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime_db", "hvdb_driver_type": "thin", "hvdb_db_secure": false,
If secure db connection is "true" then a key store will be required which contains the trusted certificate of the Oracle DB "hvdb_db_truststore": "oracle_keys",
External postgresql Database Definition The following keys define an external postgresql runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_db_type": "postgresql", "hvdb_address": "postgresql.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "5432", "hvdb_db_secure": true, "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime", "hvdb_failover_servers": [ {"address":"secondary.pg.ibm.com", "port":5432 "order":1 }, {"address":"tertiary.pg.ibm.com", "port":5432 "order":2 } ]

param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: hvdb_db_type
param.doc: The type of database that is being used. Valid values are db2, postgresql and oracle.

param.name: hvdb_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the external database server.

param.name: hvdb_port
param.doc: The port on which the external database server is listening.

param.name: hvdb_user
param.doc: The administrator name for the external database.

param.name: hvdb_password
param.doc: The administrator password for the external database.

param.name: hvdb_db2_alt_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only).

param.name: hvdb_db2_alt_port
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only).

param.name: hvdb_db_name
param.doc: The name of the external database (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle).

param.name: hvdb_db_secure
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not the external database is secure. (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle).

param.name: hvdb_db_truststore
param.doc: The SSL Key Store which contains the trusted certificate of the Oracle DB requiring secure connectivity. (Required for Oracle only when hvdb_db_secure is true)

param.name: hvdb_driver_type
param.doc: The type of Oracle JDBC driver to use. (Required for Oracle only).

param.name: hvdb_failover_servers
param.doc: An ordered list of PostgreSQL failover servers for the Runtime database. (Can be specified for PostgreSQL only).

param.name: address
param.doc: The IP addess or hostname of the failover server.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port of the failover server.

param.name: order
param.doc: The order of the failover server. This will be used to indicate the order in which the array of failover servers will be configured in the JDBC settings.
